comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -85,7 +85,7 @@ def hybrid_job(
             modules to be included. Any references to members of these modules in the hybrid job
             algorithm code will be serialized as part of the algorithm code. Default value `[]`
 
-        dependencies (str | Path): Path (absolute or relative) to a requirements.txt
+        dependencies (str | Path | list[str]): Path (absolute or relative) to a requirements.txt
             file to be used for the hybrid job.
comment.body: Ah, yes. I forgot about that. Happy to approve once the docstring is updated.

repo.description: A Python SDK for interacting with quantum devices on Amazon Braket

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -85,7 +85,7 @@ def hybrid_job(
             modules to be included. Any references to members of these modules in the hybrid job
             algorithm code will be serialized as part of the algorithm code. Default value `[]`
 
-        dependencies (str | Path): Path (absolute or relative) to a requirements.txt
+        dependencies (str | Path | list[str]): Path (absolute or relative) to a requirements.txt
             file to be used for the hybrid job.
comment.body: `include_modules` only allows python modules (`my_python_package.sub_module` etc) and does not directly access the file system, so there is no way for users to provide a `requirements.txt` through include modules. `include_modules` is a code-only construct

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -85,7 +85,7 @@ def hybrid_job(
             modules to be included. Any references to members of these modules in the hybrid job
             algorithm code will be serialized as part of the algorithm code. Default value `[]`
 
-        dependencies (str | Path): Path (absolute or relative) to a requirements.txt
+        dependencies (str | Path | list[str]): Path (absolute or relative) to a requirements.txt
             file to be used for the hybrid job.
comment.body:
```suggestion
        dependencies (str | Path | list[str]): Path (absolute or relative) to a requirements.txt
            file, or alternatively a list of strings, with each string being a `requirement specifier <https://pip.pypa.io/en/stable/reference/requirement-specifiers/#requirement-specifiers>`, to be used for the hybrid job.
```

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -85,7 +85,7 @@ def hybrid_job(
             modules to be included. Any references to members of these modules in the hybrid job
             algorithm code will be serialized as part of the algorithm code. Default value `[]`
 
-        dependencies (str | Path): Path (absolute or relative) to a requirements.txt
+        dependencies (str | Path | list[str]): Path (absolute or relative) to a requirements.txt
             file to be used for the hybrid job.
comment.body: Could we also add some detail on what happens if there is already a `requirements.txt` file that is being included through the `include_modules` parameter and you additionally specify dependencies as a list of strings?

issue.body:
*Issue #, if available:*

*Description of changes:*
